qas.question: How many Muslims made up the island's population in 1777-78?
How many Christians made up the island's population in 1777-78?
What was the population of the island in 1872?
In 1872 the island contained how many Muslims?
In 1872 the island contained how many Christians?

context: The ratio of Muslims to Christians fluctuated throughout the period of Ottoman domination. In 1777–78, <a0_0>47,000<a0_0/> Muslims constituted a majority over the island's <a1_0>37,000<a1_0/> Christians. By 1872, the population of the island had risen to <a2_0>144,000<a2_0/>, comprising <a3_0>44,000<a3_0/> Muslims and <a4_0>100,000<a4_0/> Christians. The Muslim population included numerous crypto-Christians, including the Linobambaki, a crypto-Catholic community that arose due to religious persecution of the Catholic community by the Ottoman authorities; this community would assimilate into the Turkish Cypriot community during British rule.
